Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the leak by stating that all matriculants will have to rewrite their exams, when in fact, the department of basic education has confirmed that there are no plans for such a requirement.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not appear to falter at any point.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a Facebook message and does not provide any verifiable evidence or official statements.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that universities are no longer accepting current matric students due to the leaks, but this is contradicted by the department of basic education and universities themselves.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
